subject: Programming
title: Pascal and Teaching
description: A 60-second lesson on Pascal and Teaching.

hook.text: Niklaus Wirth thought existing languages taught bad habits. He designed one for learning.

buildup.text: Pascal launched in 1970 with strict rules that forced students to write clean, organized code.

discovery.text: Universities adopted it worldwide. For two decades, Pascal was how most programmers learned.

twist.text: Professionals found Pascal too restrictive for real work. Industry chose C instead.

climax.text: Pascal faded from production but proved that language design shapes how people think.

punchline.text: A teaching language shaped a generation.

quiz.question: Why did Niklaus Wirth create Pascal?
options: To teach students good programming habits
